Articles.Content:
Nice. 

Didn't know he had a blogish part to the page

Of course, the obligatory Manley video.

And I love how Kerbal has evolved into an adjective, like MacGyver is now a verb.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-07T15:06:06Z" title="08/07/2015 03:06  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 7, 2015</time> by gargamel**

Ninja'd

Came to the forum to post this, you won this time Mr. Bond.

> 
> Didn't know he had a blogish part to the page...

Read it. Learn it. Love it. And play KSP on 'Nightmare Mode':

[https://what-if.xkcd.com/68/](https://what-if.xkcd.com/68/)

And look what happens when you hover over the drawing of the submarine with a heatshield:

![cMtI3Pi.png](http://i.imgur.com/cMtI3Pi.png)

@mythbusters844

Pffffffffffff. Just to funny. I love that guy.
Somebody should build a Jool-diving Submarine and send the Screenshot to him ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
Dude. Awesome! Great article and once again another great mention of KSP!
A probe falling into the atmosphere of Jupiter sends its last signal: "It's full of stars..."

More struts indeed.

Now I want to build a submarine, strap a gigantic heat shield to the front of it, and slam it into Jool.

WAAAAAAY ahead of you guys! 

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/AElg9)
Is Ada Munroe (the person the question is attributed to) his wife?

> 
> [-](https://goingbeyond96.files.wordpress.com/2015/01/surface-of-jupiter.jpg)pic-

It makes me think of chocolate cinnamon buns for some reasons....or chocolate swiss rolls, sprinkled with powdered sugars.

> 
> Read it. Learn it. Love it. And play KSP on 'Nightmare Mode':
> [https://what-if.xkcd.com/68/](https://what-if.xkcd.com/68/)

Even more interesting: someone make a ball 10m in diameter, with the gravity of the Mun or even heavier. If you miss your landing spot, you're back in orbit!

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> [https://goingbeyond96.files.wordpress.com/2015/01/surface-of-jupiter.jpg](https://goingbeyond96.files.wordpress.com/2015/01/surface-of-jupiter.jpg)

That's just gorgeous!
